WAR CABINET
SECRET
G.T.7739
PERSONS IN GOVERNMENT SERVICE NOT OF BRITISH OR ALLIED PARENTAGE.
Letter from Sir Maurice Hankey to Mr. Bonar Law.
July 18, 1919.
Dear Mr. Bonar Law,
The Prime Minister asks me to say that he approves the following decision of the War Cabinet taken subject to his approval on Monday, July 14, (War Cabinet 592, Minute 3):-
"It should be stated in the House of Commons that the Government had decided that persons not of British or Allied parentage, who had been retained in the service of the Government throughout the War, should not be dismissed because of their ? parentage."
Yours sincerely,
(Sd). M.P.A. Hankey.
The Rt. Hon.
A. Bonar Law, M.P.,
11, Downing Street.
